intro: Dryopetalon runcinatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive floral display and hardy nature. Dryopetalon runcinatum is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
